page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The survey area lies between the high ground of Dartmoor to the north, and the English Channel Coast to the south. The whole area is extremely hilly, reaching over 500ft in the south east and over 400ft at many other places in the area. The River Avon flows south, and is joined by the Torr Brook. These rivers are quite swift clear streams and in winter they are quite liable to flooding but only along the narrow flood plain. The valley sides and coombes are very steep and sheltered, but the hilltops catch the full strength of the winds, especially in winter when the whole area is often swept by gales. The area is near enough to the coast to enjoy long hours of sunshine. Snow in winter seldom settles long.
